exports.name: magma_release_connection
exports.description: Releases the given connection.

exports.name: magma_get_error
exports.description: Returns the first recorded error since the last time this function was called, and clears the recorded error. Incurs a round-trip to the system driver

exports.name: magma_create_context
exports.description: Creates a context on the given connection.

exports.name: magma_release_context
exports.description: Releases the context associated with the given id.

exports.name: magma_create_buffer
exports.description: Creates a memory buffer of at least the given size.

exports.name: magma_release_buffer
exports.description: Releases the given memory buffer.

exports.name: magma_duplicate_handle
exports.description: Duplicates the given handle, giving another handle that can be imported into a connection.

exports.name: magma_release_buffer_handle
exports.description: Releases the given handle.

exports.name: magma_get_buffer_id
exports.description: Returns a unique id for the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_get_buffer_size
exports.description: Returns the actual size of the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_clean_cache
exports.description: Cleans, and optionally invalidates, the cache for the region of memory specified by the given buffer, offset, and size, and write the contents to ram.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: An offset into the buffer. Must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Size of region to be cleaned. Offset + size must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

exports.name: magma_set_cache_policy
exports.description: Configures the cache for the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_get_buffer_cache_policy
exports.description: Queries the cache policy for a buffer.

exports.name: magma_get_buffer_is_mappable
exports.description: Queries whether a buffer is mappable with magma_map or magma_map_aligned

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Reserved for future use. Must be 0.

exports.name: magma_set_buffer_mapping_address_range
exports.description: Sets the mapping address range on the given buffer.  Ownership of the handle is transferred to magma.

arguments.name: handle
arguments.description: A platform specific handle to the address range.

exports.name: magma_map
exports.description: Maps the given buffer's memory into the calling process's address space.

arguments.name: addr_out
arguments.description: The returned CPU virtual address for the start of the buffer.

exports.name: magma_map_aligned
exports.description: Maps the given buffer's memory into the calling process's address space with a given alignment.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: The requested alignment. Must be a power of 2 and at least PAGE_SIZE.

arguments.name: addr_out
arguments.description: The returned CPU virtual address for the start of the buffer.

exports.name: magma_map_specific
exports.description: Maps a region of the given buffer's memory at the given CPU virtual address. Fails if the buffer was previously mapped, or if the address range is unavailable.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Offset into the buffer. Must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Size of region to be mapped. Offset + length must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

exports.name: magma_unmap
exports.description: Releases a CPU mapping for the given buffer. Should be paired with each call to one of the mapping interfaces.

arguments.name: buffer
arguments.description: A valid buffer with at least one active CPU mapping.

exports.name: magma_map_buffer_gpu
exports.description: Maps a number of pages from the given buffer onto the GPU in the connection's address space at the given address.

arguments.name: page_offset
arguments.description: Offset into the buffer in pages.

arguments.name: gpu_va
arguments.description: Destination GPU virtual address for the mapping.

exports.name: magma_unmap_buffer_gpu
exports.description: Releases the mapping at the given address from the GPU.

arguments.name: gpu_va
arguments.description: A GPU virtual address associated with an existing mapping of the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_commit_buffer
exports.description: Ensures that the given page range of a buffer is backed by physical memory. If the buffer is mapped, also ensures that the CPU page tables are populated to avoid unnecessary page faults when supported by the platform.

exports.name: magma_export
exports.description: Exports the given buffer, returning a handle that may be imported into another connection.

exports.name: magma_import
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of the buffer referred to by the given handle.

exports.name: magma_execute_command_buffer_with_resources
exports.description: Submits a command buffer for execution on the GPU, with associated resources.

arguments.name: command_buffer
arguments.description: A pointer to the command buffer to execute.

arguments.name: resources
arguments.description: An array of |command_buffer->resource_count| resources associated with the command buffer.

arguments.name: semaphore_ids
arguments.description: An array of semaphore ids; first should be |command_buffer->wait_semaphore_count| wait semaphores followed by |command_buffer->signal_signal_semaphores| signal semaphores.

exports.name: magma_execute_immediate_commands2
exports.description: Submits a series of commands for execution on the GPU without using a command buffer.

arguments.name: command_count
arguments.description: The number of commands in the provided buffer.

arguments.name: command_buffers
arguments.description: An array of command_count magma_inline_command_buffer structs.

exports.name: magma_create_semaphore
exports.description: Creates a semaphore.

exports.name: magma_release_semaphore
exports.description: Releases the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_get_semaphore_id
exports.description: Returns a unique id for the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_signal_semaphore
exports.description: Signals the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_reset_semaphore
exports.description: Resets the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_wait_semaphores
exports.description: DEPRECATED. Waits for one or all provided semaphores to be signaled. Does not reset any semaphores.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: Number of semaphores in the array.

arguments.name: timeout_ms
arguments.description: Time to wait before returning MAGMA_STATUS_TIMED_OUT.

arguments.name: wait_all
arguments.description: If true, wait for all semaphores, otherwise wait for any semaphore.

exports.name: magma_export_semaphore
exports.description: Exports the given semaphore, returning a handle that may be imported into another connection

exports.name: magma_import_semaphore
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of the semaphore referred to by the given handle.

exports.name: magma_get_notification_channel_handle
exports.description: Returns a handle that can be waited on to determine when the connection has data in the notification channel. This channel has the same lifetime as the connection and must not be closed by the client.

exports.name: magma_wait_notification_channel
exports.description: DEPRECATED. Returns MAGMA_STATUS_OK if a message is available on the notification channel before the given timeout expires.

arguments.name: timeout_ns
arguments.description: Time to wait before returning MAGMA_STATUS_TIMED_OUT.

exports.name: magma_read_notification_channel
exports.description: Reads a notification from the channel into the given buffer.

arguments.name: buffer
arguments.description: Buffer into which to read notification data.

arguments.name: buffer_size_out
arguments.description: Returned size of the notification data written to the buffer, or 0 if there are no messages pending.

exports.name: magma_initialize_tracing
exports.description: Initializes tracing

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: An open connection to a tracing provider.

exports.name: magma_device_import
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of a channel to a device.

arguments.name: device_channel
arguments.description: A channel connecting to a gpu class device.

exports.name: magma_device_release
exports.description: Releases a handle to a device

exports.name: magma_query2
exports.description: Performs a query and returns a result synchronously.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Either MAGMA_QUERY_DEVICE_ID, or a vendor-specific id starting from MAGMA_QUERY_VENDOR_PARAM_0.

exports.name: magma_query_returns_buffer2
exports.description: Performs a query for a large amount of data and puts that into a buffer. Returns synchronously

exports.name: magma_create_connection2
exports.description: Opens a connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_initialize_logging
exports.description: Initializes logging; used for debug and some exceptional error reporting.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: An open connection to the syslog service.

exports.name: magma_poll
exports.description: Waits for at least one of the given items to meet a condition. Does not reset any semaphores. Results are returned in the items array.

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: Array of poll items. Type should be either MAGMA_POLL_TYPE_SEMAPHORE or MAGMA_POLL_TYPE_HANDLE. Condition may be set to MAGMA_POLL_CONDITION_SIGNALED OR MAGMA_POLL_CONDITION_READABLE. If condition is 0 the item is ignored. Item results are set to the condition that was satisfied, otherwise 0. If the same item is given twice the behavior is undefined.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: Number of poll items in the array.

arguments.name: timeout_ns
arguments.description: Time in ns to wait before returning MAGMA_STATUS_TIMED_OUT.

exports.name: magma_connection_access_performance_counters
exports.description: Tries to enable access to performance counters. Returns MAGMA_STATUS_OK if counters were successfully enabled or MAGMA_STATUS_ACCESS_DENIED if channel is for the wrong device and counters were not successfully enabled previously.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: A handle to a channel to a gpu-performance-counter device.

exports.name: magma_map_constrained
exports.description: Maps the given buffer's memory below the given CPU virtual address. Fails if the buffer was previously mapped, or if a suitable address range is unavailable.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The length of the region to map.

arguments.name: upper_limit
arguments.description: The upper limit of the virtual address space to map the buffer.

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description: The requested alignment. Must either be 0 (default page alignment) or a power of 2 >= PAGE_SIZE.

arguments.name: addr_out
arguments.description: The returned CPU virtual address for the start of the buffer.

exports.name: magma_buffer_set_padding
exports.description: Sets how much empty address space to leave after any CPU mappings of a buffer.

arguments.name: padding
arguments.description: The number of bytes of padding to use.

exports.name: magma_connection_enable_performance_counters
exports.description: Enables a set of performance counters (the precise definition depends on the GPU driver). Disables enabled performance counters that are not in the new set. Performance counters will also be automatically disabled on connection close. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_create_performance_counter_buffer_pool
exports.description: Create a pool of buffers that performance counters can be dumped into. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: pool_out
arguments.description: A new pool id. Must not currently be in use.

arguments.name: notification_handle_out
arguments.description: A handle that should be waited on.

exports.name: magma_connection_release_performance_counter_buffer_pool
exports.description: Releases a pool of performance counter buffers. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_add_performance_counter_buffer_offsets_to_pool
exports.description: Adds a an array of buffers + offset to the pool. |offsets[n].buffer_id| is the koid of a buffer that was previously imported using ImportBuffer(). The same buffer may be added to multiple pools. The pool will hold on to a reference to the buffer even after ReleaseBuffer is called.  When dumped into this entry, counters will be written starting at |offsets[n].offset| bytes into the buffer, and up to |offsets[n].offset| + |offsets[n].size|. |offsets[n].size| must be large enough to fit all enabled counters. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: offsets
arguments.description: An array of offsets to add.

arguments.name: offsets_count
arguments.description: The number of elements in offsets.

exports.name: magma_connection_remove_performance_counter_buffer_from_pool
exports.description: Removes every offset of a buffer from the pool. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_dump_performance_counters
exports.description: Triggers dumping of the performance counters into a buffer pool. May fail silently if there are no buffers in the pool. |trigger_id| is an arbitrary ID assigned by the client that can be returned in OnPerformanceCounterReadCompleted. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: trigger_id
arguments.description: An arbitrary ID assigned by the client that will be returned in OnPerformanceCounterReadCompleted.

exports.name: magma_connection_clear_performance_counters
exports.description: Sets the values of all listed performance counters to 0. May not be supported by some hardware. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_access_performance_counters before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_read_performance_counter_completion
exports.description: Reads one performance counter completion event, if available.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: trigger_id_out
arguments.description: The trigger ID for this event.

arguments.name: buffer_id_out
arguments.description: The buffer ID for this event.

arguments.name: buffer_offset_out
arguments.description: The buffer offset for this event.

arguments.name: time_out
arguments.description: The monotonic time this event happened.

arguments.name: result_flags_out
arguments.description: A set of flags giving more information about this event.

exports.name: magma_buffer_set_name
exports.description: Sets a name for the buffer for use in debugging tools.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The 0-terminated name of the buffer. May be truncated.
